com.archibus.datasource.data
Class DataValue

java.lang.Object
  com.archibus.datasource.data.DataValue

public class DataValue
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates database field value as a Java object. Has a reference to the field definition, and can use it to:

  • Parse database-specific value into an object.

  • Parse locale-neutral string into an object.

  • Format an object into a locale-neutral string.

  • Format an object into a locale-specific string.

  • Format an object into a database-specific string.

getLocalizedValue

public java.lang.String getLocalizedValue()

Returns:
String

getNeutralValue

public java.lang.String getNeutralValue()
Returns the value formatted as ARCHIBUS locale-neutral string. This is the transport format used to send field values between the browser and the server.

Returns:
String

getOldNeutralValue

public java.lang.String getOldNeutralValue()
Returns the old value formatted as ARCHIBUS locale-neutral string. This is the transport format used to send field values between the browser and the server.

Returns:
String

getNeutralValueForChart

public java.lang.String getNeutralValueForChart()
Returns the value formatted as ARCHIBUS locale-neutral string without data separator for numbers. This is used solely for the Chart control.

Returns:
String
